728502f-b.text:
360 Bay Street, at the N.W. corner of Grant Street, showing the Planters' Hotel. It was built in 1820 and was a gathering place for Southern plantere. In 1859 it was the photographic studio of H. Hoyer, and was later taken over by J. Loeffler, well known
Staten lIsland photographer.
View 11 Summer, 1924
Views 2, 3: September 9, 1937
P. L. Sperr
728502f-b.folder: Bay Street & Grant Street, Staten Island, NY

728503f-a.text:
(1)
378, 372 and 360 Bay Street, west side, at Grant Street. No. 360 is at the Y. W. corner of Grant Street and is the old Planters' Hotel, built in 1820. No. 378 was the horc f e. Seeber (1T4 to 1907), and No. 372 belonged to Wandell (1874 and 1898)
and to T. H. Gogal (1907).
May 27, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
An exclusive view of Nos. 372 and 360. No. 372 is at
the S. W. corner of Grant Street.
May 27, 1931
P. L. Sperr
